pullRequest.title: feat(griffin) - Add support for to_lowercase and to_uppercase (feat #668)

beforeCommit.message: feat(griffin) - Add support to to_lowercase and to_uppercase

afterCommit.message: feat(griffin) - Add support for to_lowercase and to_uppercase

nodes.bodyText:
thank you for the contribution! Much appreciated!
It would be good to also implement getStrLen(). Although the default implementation will work it would be less efficient than retrieving string length without printing uppercase characters to sink
This implementation is needlessly allocating. Calls to this method are made from function, that has local CharSink already. String instantiation is not required.

The ascii uppercase method is insufficient. You should use
Character.toUpperCase()

it is more generic but slower.
Same things apply to "lowercase"
it would also be good to have test for non-ascii characters

toLowerCaseAscii() is used elsewhere, where only ascii characters allowed. We need to keep implementation unchanged.  The SQL to_lowercase() should call Character.toLowerCase() directly.
Calling Character.toLowerCase() from toLowerCaseAscii() is also misleading, because implementation is no longer "ascii" specific.

afterCommit.message: Rebase and fix typo in the class name
Cache call to length in local variable

commit.message: feat(griffin) - Add support for to_lowercase and to_uppercase
Replace custom lowercase and uppercase methods for Character#toLowercase and Character#toUppercase
Remove unecessary instanciation when a sink is provided to Chars#toLowerCaseAscii and Chars#toUpperCaseAscii
Rebase and fix typo in the class name
Cache call to length in local variable

beforeCommit.message: Cache call to length in local variable

afterCommit.message: Cache call to length in local variable
